DataElement.preferredName: Data Monitoring Committee Responsibility Document Version Or Media Text Content ISO21090.ED.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A key document that, together with the study protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), prospectively defines the study's Data Monitoring Committee (DMC) infrastructure and, in particular, the DMC's responsibilities; stipulates who sees blinded results and who sees unblinded results; and establishes a method for communication between the DMC and the sponsor. A textual or media-based representation that is the full or comprehensive narrative or content of the document.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Data Monitoring Committee Responsibility Document Version Or Media Text Content
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).:A group delegated to consider some matter; a self-constituted organization to promote something.:A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible.:A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any mechanism of mass communication.:The words of something written.:Everything that is included in a collection, container, or communication.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Data Monitoring Committee Responsibility Document Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).:A group delegated to consider some matter; a self-constituted organization to promote something.:A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible.:A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
The act of observing something (and sometimes keeping a record of it).
A group delegated to consider matters concerning clinical studies or trials.
A duty, obligation, or burden; something for which one is responsible.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Any mechanism of mass communication.:The words of something written.:Everything that is included in a collection, container, or communication.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Everything that is included in a collection, container, or communication.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Data only for human interpretation or machine processing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
